content: be careful not to break yarn as you cinch together leave the tails of the stem out as you seam together the top using the darning needle pull each tail of the stem through the body of the pumpkin and pull out in the center of the bottom pull the yarn tightly through being careful not to break yarn to squish the piece down which will shorten the length and widen the width knot these two tails together and weave into the bottom to hide end and fasten_off to make the sections cut a large length of yarn and beginning at the bottom of the pumpkin pull the yarn through the medium pumpkin pumpkin and bring out at the top near the stem leaving a long tail on the bottom wrap tightly around the edge of the pumpkin and pull back through the bottom to the top repeat until you have desired pumpkin effect if your yarn is too short fasten_off at the top and weave in end get some more yarn and begin until you have the desired number of sections fasten the tail at the bottom pull tightly and weave in end please email me at iknit2purl2@gmail com or contact me on ravelry iknit2purl2 if you have any questions i love seeing your projects tag me on social media #iknit2purl2 #iknit2purl2designs 4 iknit2purl2 llc ©2024
